subject: Learning
title: Judgment of Learning: Do You Really Know It?
description: Learn Judgment of Learning: Do You Really Know It? in one minute.

hook.text: After studying, you rate yourself 90% ready. The test score comes back: 55%. What went wrong?

buildup.text: Judgment of learning (JOL) is your prediction of how well you'll remember something on a future test.

discovery.text: JOLs are often inaccurate because they're based on current familiarity, not future retrievability.

twist.text: Delayed JOLsâ€”made a day after studyingâ€”are far more accurate than immediate ones.

climax.text: Training students to make delayed judgments dramatically improves their study decisions.

punchline.text: Don't judge learning in the moment. Wait a day and check again.

quiz.question: Why are immediate judgments of learning often inaccurate?
options: They're based on current familiarity, not future retrievability
